summary: A 2009 executive order called for actions to increase veteran employment in the federal government. But concerns have been raised about the retention and job satisfaction of newly hired veterans. We found that, compared to similar non-veterans, veterans: Left government jobs at a higher rate (6.7% vs. 5%) between FYs 2014-2018 Resigned 1.6 times more often Left in their first 5 years at higher rates...
title: Veteran Federal Employment: OPM and Agencies Could Better Leverage Data to Help Improve Veteran Retention Rates
